intro: Ebenus barbigera, commonly known as the hairy thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact cluster. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides. Ebenus barbigera is an herbaceous perennial that produces seeds through a unique structure called a pappus.
